input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Find Location
This wrapper search out for the ‘Location’ record(s) from pool of ‘Location’ records in the application
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>retrieve-location</operation-name> <model> <keys> <location> <value>MyLocation25</value> <type>String</type> </location> </keys> <instance> <location> <value>MyLocation25</value> <type>String</type> </location> <location-name> <value>Location Name</value> <type>String</type> </location-name>
<address> <type>Array</type> <address> <element> <value>Address</value> <type>String</type> </element> </address> </address> <city> <value>City</value> <type>String</type> </city> <state> <value>State</value> <type>String</type> </state> <zip> <value>zip</value> <type>String</type> </zip> <primary-contact> <value>primary contact</value> <type>String</type> </primary-contact> <phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </phone> <location-open-time> <value>11:00:00</value> <type>Time</type> </location-open-time> <location-closing-time> <value>12:00:00</value> <type>Time</type> </location-closing-time> <primary-contact-department> <value>primary contact department</value> <type>String</type> </primary-contact-department> <location-code> <value>Location Code</value> <type>String</type> </location-code> <comments> <type>Array</type> <comments> <element> <value>Comment line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>Comment line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </comments> </comments> <country> <value>Country</value> <type>String</type> </country> <email> <value>Email</value> <type>String</type> </email> <company> <value>Company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <site-category> <value>A</value> <type>String</type> </site-category> </instance> </model> </item> </items> Elements’ Description: Locating any record takes place in following manner-
The fields inside instance describe the record. Out of which some are key elements.
Following are cases,
Case1: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only key then the record is uniquely located.
Case2: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) key element(s) along with some other elements then the record is located only by key elements. All other fields (elements) get ignored. Record would get uniquely located as we’re providing the key element(s).
Case3: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only those elements that are not key. Then the record is located by logically ANDing all those elements with the corresponding elements of existing record.
Case4: You don’t provide anything. Then all company records would be fetched.
NOTE: When we provide some element(s) (which are not key) in <keys> element then we’re forcibly saying that “search the record(s) with these key elements (the elements in <keys> element.)” In such cases, the elements given inside <instance> element are simply ignored.
NOTE: For a given pattern string P is said to be matched with text string T if the string P is prefix string of T. for example,
P = xyz T = xyz123 Then P is matched with T.
If, P = xyz T = 1xyz23 Then P is not matched with T.
etc.
this means, if you’re searching for vendor, and you’ve given vendor name to be “abc” and if there are two records with vendor name “abc123” and “abc456” then both these record would be fetched.
(this is solely application specific.)
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required] This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required] :
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>retrieve-location</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required] : used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Location[Optional]: The location field.
Name of this element in the application: Location.
Valid Values: Any string.
Location-name[Optional]: The location name field of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Location Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Address [Optional]: It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Note: one element shows one line in the address field.
Element [Optional]: Shows one line in the address field.
Name of this element in the application: Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
City[Optional]: The city name.
Name of this element in the application: City.
Valid Values: Any string.
State[Optional]: The name of state.
Name of this element in the application: State/ Province.
Valid Values: Any string.
Zip [Optional]: zip code.
Name of this element in the application.
Valid Values: Any string.
Primary-contact [Optional]: the primary contact.
Name of this element in the application: Primary Contact.
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Phone [Optional]: The phone number.
Name of this element in the application: Phone.
Valid Values: Any string.
Location-open-time [Optional]: The opening time of the location.
Name of this element in the application: Hours (1st field)
Valid Values: Any input in time format.
Time Format: HH:MM:SS HH -> hour, MM -> min., SS -> sec.
Location-closing-time [Optional]: The closing time of the location.
Name of this element in the application: Hours (2nd field)
Valid Values: Any string.
Primary-contact-department [Optional]: The primary contact department.
Name of this element in the location: Department.
Valid Values: Any string.
Location-code[Optional]: The code for the location.
Name of this element in the location: Location Code.
Valid Values: Any string.
Comment [Optional]: Related comment. It’s an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: This shows one line in the comment filed.
Name of these elements in the application: Comment (one element shows one line.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Country[Optional]: Country name.
Name of this element in the application: Country.
Valid Values: Any string.
Email [Optional]: Email ID.
Name of this field in the application: Email.
Valid Values: Any string.
Company[Optional]: Company name.
Name of this field in the application: Company.
Valid Values: Any string.
Site-category[Optional]: Category of the place.
Name of this element in the application: Site Category.
Valid Values: A, B, C, D. A -> Critical Site, B -> Major Site, C -> Satellite Site, D -> Home site.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>
